message:
Stack Overflow, for sure lots of us have visited this website at least once before, and for sure lots of us could wonder and what stack overflow mean, a small brief about that as follow:

Of course, a computerâ€™s memory is finite, so only a certain amount can be used to store activation records on the program-execution stack. If more method calls occur than can have their activation records stored, an error known as a stack overflow occurs.

data.message: If a developer knows StackOVerflow the website, and does not know what a stack overflow exception is, I'd be a bit worried.
That's for dummies like me :P I didn't expect that everyone here is an expert :D

Well, everyone here is a geek by definition :)
On more serious note, the guy / lady who got to know how to lookup answers in StackOverflow site and didn't know what the word means won't benefit from this tip a big deal. They would lack a lot of ground that they need extensive study to cover. If they are good enough at English to understand your tip in the first place, I expect they'll easily find references to build that ground.

And to address your comment in a more direct way, no, this group is not the best for the total newbies in development in general, although maybe newbies in certain technologies / frameworks of course (we have various people from .NET, Ruby, etc. who may not know other frameworks well), but not total newbies in dev world.

We "need" it to stay this way. We need to keep the bar high. Otherwise we will lose interest from many members, and more importantly we will lose our main differentiator from the bazillion beginner groups out there on Facebook and all over the internet.
Alright Mr.Mohamed Meligy I got your point :D
